meanings.definition: To give advice or guidance to someone.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys advising her friends on their problems.
meanings.sent2: I will be advising the new students on their class schedules.
meanings.sent3: The wise owl was advising the young squirrel on how to find acorns.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse stood tall, advising ships safely through the stormy seas.
meanings.sent5: The experienced hiker was advising the group on the best trail to take.

meanings.definition: To recommend or suggest a course of action.
meanings.sent1: He is advising that we take the scenic route for our road trip.
meanings.sent2: The doctor is advising bed rest for a speedy recovery.
meanings.sent3: The talking parrot was advising the cat to chase its own tail for fun.
meanings.sent4: The compass needle always points north, advising travelers on their journey.
meanings.sent5: The weather forecast is advising everyone to carry an umbrella today.

meanings.definition: The act of providing counsel or recommendations.
meanings.sent1: Her advising has helped many people make better decisions.
meanings.sent2: The advising from the financial planner was invaluable for their savings.
meanings.sent3: The magic mirror's advising led the princess to her true love.
meanings.sent4: The stars in the sky seemed to be advising the lost traveler on the right path.
meanings.sent5: The wise old tree's advising was sought by all the animals in the forest.
